question.text: Given the masses of various atomic particles <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">P</mi></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>0072</mn><mtext> </mtext><mi mathvariant="normal">u</mi></math>, <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">n</mi></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>0087</mn><mtext> </mtext><mi mathvariant="normal">u</mi></math>, <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">e</mi></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn><mo>.000548</mo><mtext> </mtext><mi mathvariant="normal">u</mi></math>, <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi><mover><mi mathvariant="normal">v</mi><mo>¯</mo></mover></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math>, <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">d</mi></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>.0141</mo><mtext> </mtext><mi mathvariant="normal">u</mi></math>, where <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi mathvariant="normal">p</mi><mo>=</mo></math>proton, <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi mathvariant="normal">n</mi><mo>≡</mo></math>neutron, <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi mathvariant="normal">e</mi><mo>≡</mo></math>electron, <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mover><mi mathvariant="normal">v</mi><mo>¯</mo></mover><mo>≡</mo></math>antineutrino and <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mover><mi mathvariant="normal">d</mi><mo>¯</mo></mover><mo>≡</mo></math>deuteron. Which of the following process is allowed by momentum and energy conservation :

options.text: <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi mathvariant="normal">n</mi><mo>+</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">n</mi><mo>→</mo></math> deuterium atom (electron bound to the nucleus)

solution.text:
For n+p→d+γ,

The mass defect, ∆m=mp+mn-md

⇒∆m=1.0072+1.0087-2.0141

⇒∆m=0.0018

⇒∆m>0

∴only n+p→d+γ is possible
